message.content:
cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.NI, cs.SC, cs.SY

This paper discusses the architectural and performance improvements of a network fabric for multi-GPU systems on HPC clusters. The paper also mentions the use of FPGA-based PCIe boards and RDMA protocols. Based on these topics, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also mentions 3D torus network, which falls under the category of cs.AR (Architecture). The use of FPGA-based PCIe boards and RDMA protocols suggests the paper could also belong to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the use of GPUs for scientific HPC, which could place it under cs.SC (Scientific Computing and Simulation) or cs.SY (Systems and Control).
